Police noted layout challenges, adding organizers shared crowd management responsibility.

Altman stressed both risks and opportunities, framing AI as a transformative but manageable force for society.

The unidentified vessel fired into a crowd of diners before fleeing the scene. Authorities are questioning one person of interest as the investigation continues into the deadly incident.

His bail plea was rejected, with a court noting custodial interrogation is vital to unravel the extensive fraud and intimidation pattern.

Missing lawyers & witnesses: Why are 5.3cr cases pending in Indian courts? Key reasons
description: The Supreme Court recently underscored speedy trial as an unimpeachable right amidst 5.34 crore pending cases nationwide. Key reasons for delays include unavailable counsels, absconding accused, and missing witnesses. The SC directed High Courts to ensure trials are not adjourned for counsel absence and proceed day-to-day, criticizing trial courts for flouting this mandate.

description: MP Nagar police booked lawyer Aslam Ali for allegedly molesting and stalking a 22-year-old woman inside the district court premises. Ali reportedly approached her, asked personal questions, and inappropriately touched her after she declined his advances. Advocates accompanied the woman to lodge a complaint, and an investigation is underway.

'Inappropriate touch during consultation': Indian-origin doctor arrested in California
H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
description: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: Black lives matter fallout: FBI agents photographed kneeling during Floyd protests fired
description: The FBI has reportedly dismissed approximately 20 agents who were photographed kneeling during 2020 racial justice demonstrations. These firings are part of a wider personnel shake-up under Director Kash Patel, which also saw the removal of agents involved in high-profile investigations, including those concerning former President Trump.

title: Empty UN: Bibi delivers speech as dozens of nations walkout
description: Israeli PM Netanyahu, in a defiant UN address, defended his nation's actions and pledged to "finish the job" against Hamas. He sharply criticised US allies for recognising a Palestinian state, labelling it a reward for terrorism and asserting Israel's refusal to accept a "terrorist state." Amid delegate walkouts, Netanyahu accused leaders of succumbing to pressure, while privately acknowledging Israel's intelligence.

title: Trump targets 100,000 Indian OPT students in US with rising site visits
description: The Trump administration has increased unannounced site visits for nearly 100,000 Indian students on the OPT programme in the US, particularly those on STEM-OPT extensions. USCIS and ICE officers are inspecting both workplaces and student residences to verify compliance with visa regulations. Attorneys report a rise in Requests for Evidence (RFEs) and advise students and employers to maintain accurate records and promptly update employment or address changes to avoid jeopardising F-1 visa status.
